title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for Stadium Series game against Lightning in Tampa.
Players used Boston Costume to design unique outfits with tricorne hats, wigs, and shoe buckles.
Tampa Bay Lightning matched theme, wearing classic Buccaneers 'Creamsicle' uniforms led by Bucs players.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to White Sox for minor leaguer Gage Ziehl.
Hicks, part of a 2025 blockbuster trade, is set to earn $12.5 million in 2026 with one more contract year.
The trade marks the 13th deal for the Red Sox this offseason, addressing salary constraints.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The Something in the Way festival at Roadrunner featured performances from two dozen indie bands.
Photographer Ben Stas captured performances by bands like The Hotelier, Teen Suicide, and Explosions in the Sky.
The festival spans a weekend, showcasing diverse music styles from emo to screamo.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots fullback Jack Westover's sister won $18,000 for predicting a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup.
The bet was placed in August, well before the start of the regular NFL season, with a $5 wager.
Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks will take place at Levi's Stadium on February 8.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel addressed fans at the Patriots' send-off rally in Foxborough.
Drake Maye appeared despite missing practice Friday due to illness and shoulder injury.
The Patriots will play the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium on February 8.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'SNL' on January 31, with Cardi B as the musical guest.
Former 'SNL' star Pete Davidson appeared in the political cold open, while Stellan Skarsgård made special appearances.
Jack McBrayer appeared during Weekend Update, but Cardi B's boyfriend, Stefon Diggs, was absent from the show.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald, a Scituate native, grew up dreaming of becoming the Red Sox general manager.
Macdonald transitioned from baseball to football coaching after an ACL injury ended his playing career.
Macdonald, head coach since 2024, has led the Seahawks to a 24-10 record and a Super Bowl appearance.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Patriots held a Super Bowl LX send-off rally at Gillette Stadium, featuring speeches by Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
Patriots captains Drake Maye, Marcus Jones, Hunter Henry, and others spoke during the event before departing for California.
Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks will be held at Levi's Stadium on February 8, with the Seahawks favored to win by 4.5 points.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praised Patriots' culture under coach Mike Vrabel, encouraging free agents to join the team.
Patriots have significant cap space and are contenders, boosting their appeal to free agents this offseason.
Top free agents like George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips could enhance the Patriots' roster in 2026.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth among the Patriots' top 10 free-agent signings in franchise history.
Williams contributed 5.5 sacks this season, including two in the postseason, aiding the Patriots' Super Bowl LX run.
His four-year, $104 million contract is the largest in Patriots' history, with $63 million guaranteed.
